TEXT: The applicant is a NORP citizen , born in DATE and currently living in GPE . Before the Commission he is represented by Mr. PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE am GPE .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
In or DATE , when he was DATE , the applicant arrived with his family , his parents and CARDINAL brothers and sisters , in GPE . A younger sister was born there later .
The applicant attended school in LOC and worked thereafter in his parents ' restaurant . From DATE to DATE he was the manager of this restaurant .
In DATE and DATE the applicant was convicted of theft and aggravated theft and fined , respectively sentenced to DATE imprisonment on probation .

On DATE and DATE the applicant was convicted by ORG ( Landgericht ) of armed robbery in CARDINAL cases and sentenced to DATE imprisonment . ORG fixed later a cumulative sentence ( PERSON ) of DATE and DATE imprisonment .

After having served CARDINAL of this sentence , ORG ( Oberlandesgericht ) suspended the remainder of the sentence on probation having regard to the favourable prognosis of the applicant 's personality .

On DATE ORG ordered the applicant to leave GPE on the ground that the applicant had been convicted of criminal offences and sentenced to DATE imprisonment . Reference was made in particular to Section CARDINAL para . CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) of LAW ) . According to this provision , a foreigner shall be expelled from GPE if he has been finally sentenced to a minimum of DATE imprisonment for having committed wilfully CARDINAL or more offences ( ... wird ein Ausländer ausgewiesen , wenn er wegen einer oder mehrerer vorsätzlicher ORG rechtskräftig zu einer GPE von mindestens fünf Jahren verurteilt worden ist ) .
The applicant lodged an administrative appeal ( Widerspruch ) against the deportation order . These proceedings are still pending .
At the same time the applicant requested to suspend , pending the appeal proceedings , the execution of the deportation order ( Antrag auf einstweiligen PERSON ) .

On DATE , ORG ( Verwaltungsgericht ) at GPE an der Weinstrasse dismissed this request . The ORG found that the deportation order had been issued in accordance with the relevant provisions of LAW . The competent authorities did not enjoy any margin of appreciation when ordering the applicant 's deportation . Having regard to the applicant 's sentence of DATE imprisonment and the seriousness of the offences committed by him , the public interest in the prevention of disorder and crime outweighed the applicant 's interests in staying in GPE although he had lived with his family in that country for DATE . Furthermore there was a particular public interest in enforcing the deportation order rapidly with a view to deterring other foreigners from committing similar offences .
The applicant 's appeal ( Beschwerde ) against the refusal to be granted a suspension of the deportation order was dismissed by PERSON ( Oberverwaltungsgericht ) on DATE .

On DATE ORG ( Bundesverfassungsgericht ) , sitting as a panel of CARDINAL judges , refused to admit the applicant 's constitutional appeal against the above decisions , on the ground that it offered no prospect of success .
ORG held that it was not in breach of any constitutional right to expect the applicant to pursue the appeal proceedings from GPE .
On DATE the applicant was expelled to GPE .
